In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if occursin(r"^\s+$", word) || length(wrapped_text) + length(word) <= text_width
            wrapped_text *= word * " "
        else
            wrapped_text *= "\n$(word)"
        end
    end

    return wrap_text
end
```
Here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Praesent non justo in odio efficitur malesuada.
"""

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This will output the wrapped text with a maximum width of 20 characters per line.
